title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Sheds Citi Stake, Trims Other Big Bank Holdings
snippets:
Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) sold its shares of Citigroup (C) during the first quarter, while trimming its stakes in Bank of America (BAC) and Capital One (COF).

Berkshire shed its more than 14.6 million shares of Citigroup in the first three months of the year, a 13-F filing revealed Thursday. The form, which offers a snapshot of Berkshire's portfolio at the end of the quarter, does not capture any changes the company would have made since the end of March.

The conglomerate also trimmed its long-term holding in Bank of America by 48.6 million shares. It reduced its stake in Capital One by 300,000 shares, and shed all its shares in Brazilian fintech firm Nu Holdings (NU). Berkshire shrank its Liberty Media Series C Formula One (FWONK) stake, and sold shares of Charter Communications (CHTR), DaVita (DVA), and T-Mobile (TMUS) too.

Meanwhile, Buffett's firm more than doubled its position in alcoholic beverage maker Constellation Brands (STZ) to just over 12 million shares. Shares of the Modelo parent climbed close to 3% in after-hours trading.

Berkshire also added nearly 240,000 shares of Dominos Pizza (DPZ) and over 112,000 shares of electronics firm Heico (HEI). It expanded positions in VeriSign (VRSN), Sirius XM (SIRI), Pool Corp. (POOL), and Occidental Petroleum (OXY) as well.

After trimming its stake in Apple (AAPL) last year, Berkshire did not make any changes to its position in the iPhone maker during the period.

Shares of Berkshire have taken a hit in the wake of Buffett's announcement earlier this month that he plans to step down as CEO, with vice chair Greg Abel set to take the helm at year-end. Still, they’ve outperformed the broader market, with shares up about 12% since the start of the year, while the S&P 500 added just 0.6%.
titles: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Sheds Citi Stake, Trims Other Big Bank Holdings
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold its Citigroup shares and reduced holdings in Bank of America, Capital One, and several others in the first quarter, as revealed by a 13-F filing. Meanwhile, it increased investments in Constellation Brands, Dominos Pizza, Heico, and others. Despite Buffett announcing his plan to step down as CEO by year-end, Berkshire Hathaway's shares have risen about 12% since the start of the year, outperforming the S&P 500's 0.6% increase. Greg Abel is set to succeed Buffett.
constructiveness_reason: The story is constructive as it provides useful insights into Berkshire Hathaway's investment strategy, which could inform readers' understanding of market trends and investment decisions. However, it doesn't report on solutions or improvements, nor does it increase awareness about systems or causes.

title: Caltech’s Smart Bandage Detects Infection Days in Advance
snippets: Caltech’s iCares bandage samples fluid and tracks wound biomarkers to detect infection early and predict healing outcomes. Caltech professor of medical engineering Wei Gao and his team are developing a next-generation smart bandage—a “lab on skin”—that could help patients and caregivers monitor chronic wounds, deliver treatment, and accelerate healing. Designed for cuts, incisions, scrapes, and [...]
titles: Caltech’s Smart Bandage Detects Infection Days in Advance
summary: Caltech has developed a smart bandage, named iCares, which can detect infections in wounds days before they become apparent. Created by Professor Wei Gao and his team, this innovative "lab on skin" technology samples fluid and tracks biomarkers to predict healing outcomes. It aims to improve care for chronic wounds by enabling early detection and treatment, potentially speeding up the healing process.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive. It provides useful information about a new technology that has the potential to improve wound care. It also highlights progress in the field of medical technology, reporting on an innovative solution to a common problem.

title: Scientists Discover Temperature-Controlled Switch That Powers Fertility
snippets: A mouse study may pave the way for new approaches to contraception and infertility treatment. Sperm are surprisingly picky when it comes to temperature. In mammals, including humans, they perform best in environments that are a few degrees cooler than normal body temperature. This raises an intriguing question: how do these heat-sensitive cells manage to [...]
titles: Scientists Discover Temperature-Controlled Switch That Powers Fertility
summary: Scientists have discovered a temperature-controlled switch in sperm that could lead to new contraception and infertility treatments. This finding, based on a mouse study, highlights how sperm performance is optimal in environments slightly cooler than the normal body temperature of mammals, including humans. This research may significantly impact future reproductive health strategies.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful insights into the field of reproductive health. It reports on a new discovery that could lead to new treatments for contraception and infertility. However, it doesn't provide actionable insights for the reader.

title: This Popular Anti-Aging Supplement Might Be a Waste of Money
snippets: Despite an 85% reduction in NAD+ levels, mice maintained normal muscle health and function, according to new research from the Treebak Group. Since natural aging typically causes only up to a 30% decline in NAD levels, these findings cast doubt on the purported health benefits promoted by NAD+ supplement companies. In the Netflix documentary Don’t [...]
titles: This Popular Anti-Aging Supplement Might Be a Waste of Money
summary: New research from the Treebak Group shows that even with an 85% reduction in NAD+ levels, mice still maintained normal muscle health and function. This finding challenges the effectiveness of NAD+ supplements, which are marketed for anti-aging benefits, especially since natural aging usually results in up to a 30% decline in NAD levels. This casts doubt on the claims made by NAD+ supplement companies regarding their health benefits.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful information challenging the effectiveness of a popular supplement. It increases awareness about the potential misinformation in the supplement industry and could influence readers' decision-making regarding their health and wellness purchases.

title: Are entangled qubits following a quantum Moore's law?
snippets: Several recent experiments showcase a sharp increase in the number of quantum bits that can be entangled, echoing Moore’s law for increasing computing power on traditional chips
titles: Are entangled qubits following a quantum Moore's law?
summary: Recent experiments have significantly increased the number of entangled quantum bits (qubits), mirroring the growth pattern of Moore's law, which describes the doubling of computing power on traditional chips approximately every two years. This advancement in quantum computing demonstrates a notable leap in the potential for more powerful and efficient computing capabilities.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides an understanding of recent advancements in quantum computing, which could be useful for readers interested in technology and its progress. It also gives insight into the potential future of computing, thus empowering the reader with knowledge.
